PROVIDING TRAINING TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE OF PROPER PESTICIDE USAGE, REDUCED PESTICIDE EXPOSURE TO AGRICULTURAL WORKERS AND HANDLERS, INCREASE POLLINATOR AWARENESS AND PROTECTION OF ENDANGERED SPECIES). THE PROGRAMS PURPOSE IS TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT WITH THE CITIZENS AS THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES. 

ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE PROVIDING TRAINING AND OUTREACH TO MEMBERS OF THE CHOCTAW NATION AND OTHER SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE ABOUT PESTICIDES AND FEDERAL INSECTICIDE, FUNGICIDE, AND RODENTICIDE ACT (FIFRA), DEVELOPING STAFF KNOWLEDGE OF PESTICIDE RELATED TOPICS TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR FUTURE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS, ESTABLISHING CONTACTS AT THE STATE AND OTHER TRIBAL NATIONS TO COLLABORATE ABOUT PESTICIDE PROGRAMS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE QUARTERLY PERFORMANCE REPORTS, OUTREACH MATERIALS INCLUDING PAMPHLETS, ARTICLES AND TRAININGS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE BUILDING STAFF KNOWLEDGE ABOUT PESTICIDES AND FEDERAL INSECTICIDE, FUNGICIDE, AND RODENTICIDE ACT  (FIFRA) THROUGH TRAININGS WITH EPA AND OTHER TRIBES IN OKLAHOMA, ESTABLISHING RELEVANT CONTACTS WITH THE STATE AND TRIBAL NATIONS FOR COMMUNICATION AND OFFERING EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO TRIBAL MEMBERS WITH THE GOAL OF EXPANDING THE PESTICIDE PROGRAM. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZENS OF CHOCTAW NATION AS WELL AS MEMBERS OF THE LOCAL SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES OF SOUTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA.

THE PESTICIDE SECTION OF THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT (MDARD) LABORATORY DIVISION WILL BE HOSTING THE ANNUAL NATIONAL LAB WORKSHOP IN EAST LANSING IN THE FALL OF 2022. DIFFERENT FROM PREVIOUS YEARS, THIS WORKSHOP WILL FOCUS ON LABORATORY AND FIELD STAFF COMMUNICATION, MICHIGAN'S TRANSITION TO PAPERLESS DATA REVIEW, AND OTHER METHOD SHARING AND STATE ROUNDTABLE DISCUSSIONS. THE WORKSHOP WILL BE HELD AT THE LABORATORY DIVISION'S GEAGLEY LABORATORY LOCATED IN EAST LANSING AT 1615 S. HARRISON RD. STAFF WILL PREPARE THE WORKSHOP MATERIAL REGARDING LAB/FIELD STAFF COMMUNICATION, PAPERLESS DATA REVIEW, AND METHOD SHARING. ROUND TABLES AMONGST PARTICIPANTS WILL BE FACILITATED FOR STATES TO SHARE SCOPE OF TESTING, ANY TESTING IN DEVELOPMENT, RECENT HOMERUNS AND CHALLENGES. ATTENDEES WILL ALSO PARTICIPATE IN AN OFF-SITE FIELD TRIP TO MDARD'S METROLOGY LABORATORY IN WILLIAMSTON, MICHIGAN.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL RESULT IN ENHANCED PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT (E.G., REDUCED PESTICIDE EXPOSURE TO AGRICULTURAL WORKERS AND HANDLES, PROTECTION OF WATER RESOURCES FROM PESTICIDES, AND PROTECTION OF ENDANGERED SPECIES). BASED ON AN ANALYSIS OF THE APPLICATION AND PROPOSED WORKPLAN, THIS APPLICATION ALIGNS WITH THE AGENCY'S PRIORITIES AND IS EXPECTED TO BE EFFECTIVE AND SUCCESSFUL IN ACHIEVING PROGRAM GOALS/OBJECTIVES. THE APPLICANT PROVIDES OUTREACH AND ENFORCEMENT OF PESTICIDES RULES AND REGULATIONS. THESE ACTIVITIES HELP ENSURE THE SAFETY OF CHEMICALS IN THE MARKETPLACE AND CREATE MORE EFFECTIVE PARTNERSHIPS ON TRIBAL LANDS.ACTIVITIES:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT CONTINUES THE RECIPIENT'S IMPLEMENTATION OF ITS PESTICIDE REGULATORY AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMPLIANCE MONITORY, ENFORCEMENT AND PROVIDE OUTREACH, COMMUNICATION, AND TRAINING AS APPROPRIATE AS A RESULT OF NEW EMERGING ISSUES, RULES, REGULATIONS, AND REGISTRATION AND REGISTRATION REVIEW DECISIONS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EACH FEDERALLY CREDENTIALED INSPECTOR PLANS TO CONDUCT 40 INSPECTIONS OF PESTICIDE APPLICATORS AND COMPLETE INSPECTION REPORTS FOR EACH INSPECTION. SUBMIT QUARTERLY REPORTS DETAILING ACTIVITIES THAT OCCURRED. THE 4TH QUARTER REPORT IS WAIVED AND INSTEAD AN END OF YEAR REPORT IS SUBMITTED. REPORTS MUST BE RECEIVED BY EPA WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER THE END OF THE QUARTER. PROVIDE OUTREACH AND COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE BY DISTRIBUTING OUTREACH MATERIALS (SUPPLIED BY THE EPA) INCLUDING FACT SHEETS AND QANDA TO DEALERS, REFILLERS AND COMMERCIAL APPLICATORS ON THE CONTAINER/CONTAINMENT REGS DURING INSPECTIONS AND/OR TRAININGS.

DESCRIPTION:THE WORK PROPOSED BY THE SAGINAW CHIPPEWA TRIBE INVOLVES THE DEVELOPMENT OF STAFF AND MANAGEMENT EXPERTISE ON PESTICIDE PROGRAM ISSUES AND ENFORCEMENT. SUCH ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COLLABORATIVE ATTENDANCE AND PARTICIPATION IN TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH PREP, PIRT, FIELD-WORK EXCURSIONS, AND OTHER APPROPRIATE ACTIVITIES. THIS WILL BE DONE THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE STATE/FEDERAL PESTICIDE REGULATORY AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS. THIS AGREEMENT WILL RESULT IN ENHANCED PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT THROUGH THE ASSESSMENT OF PESTICIDE USE ON TRIBAL PROPERTY, EVALUATION OF COMMUNITY CONCERNS, RESPONSE TO QUESTIONS AND RESIDENTS ON TRIBAL PROPERTY, AND THE FILING OF COMPLAINTS TO EPA/MDARD AS APPROPRIATE.
